meanings.definition: To run or move swiftly along a specified path or route.
meanings.sent1: The river coursed through the valley, rushing over rocks and pebbles.
meanings.sent2: The athlete coursed through the track, aiming for the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel coursed up the tree, trying to escape the playful dog.
meanings.sent4: Excitement coursed through her veins as she approached the stage to receive her award.
meanings.sent5: The wind coursed through the open window, bringing in a refreshing breeze.

meanings.definition: A continuous flow or succession of something.
meanings.sent1: The course of events led to an unexpected outcome.
meanings.sent2: The course of the river was altered by the construction of a dam.
meanings.sent3: The course of the movie kept the audience engaged till the end.
meanings.sent4: The course of history is shaped by the actions of individuals.
meanings.sent5: The course of the illness took a turn for the better after the new treatment.

meanings.definition: A series of lectures or lessons in a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The course on astronomy covered the basics of the solar system.
meanings.sent2: The course on painting techniques inspired her to create beautiful art.
meanings.sent3: The course on cooking was a delicious way to learn new recipes.
meanings.sent4: The course on photography taught him how to capture stunning images.
meanings.sent5: The course on history delved into the events that shaped the world.
